alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 02 at 4:19PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Along the Bear River, to the south of Cokeville. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 419 PM MDT, Current river forecast shows the Bear River, below Pixley Dam, rising to around 8.9 feet by Thursday afternoon diminishing some into the weekend. Minor flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Western Lincoln County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
